Analysis & Notes: GOOD: Strong opener. Stun is valuable CC. Low damage but utility justifies cost.
DECENT: Situational. Good in multi-enemy fights but weaker than Shield Bash in 1v1.

Special Effects: Taunts all enemies for 2 turns + 50% max EP
Analysis & Notes: EXCELLENT: Core tanking tool. Cheap EP cost. Forces aggro and generates resources.
GOOD: Higher damage than Shield Bash + bleed. Solid damage option.
VERY GOOD: High single-target damage. Armor break helps entire party.
SITUATIONAL: Free but prevents attacking. Needs testing - might be too restrictive.
GOOD: AOE with stun potential. High EP cost but multi-target CC is valuable.
ULTIMATE: Massive AOE damage. ~90% of max EP. Worthy capstone ability.

Special Effects: Taunts all, +75% EP, +20% party damage for 3 turns
Analysis & Notes: ULTIMATE: Free super-buff. Upgraded Battle Cry. Excellent support for entire party.
GOOD: Only level 1 AOE in game. Expensive but valuable for multi-target.
EXCELLENT: Hard counter to armored enemies. Strong damage + utility.
INTERESTING: Free damage + EP generation. Weak damage but enables ability spam.
GOOD: Free defensive option. Counter-attack makes it better than pure dodge.
DECENT: Similar to Rending Strike but ranged. DOT adds value over time.
VERY GOOD: Damage + debuff. Good defensive option for ranged DPS.
EXCELLENT: AOE with stun. Lower cost than Whirlwind. Ranged safety is huge.
CORE ABILITY: Only healing in early game. Avg 7 HP is okay but might need buff.
EXCELLENT: Bypasses defense entirely. Oracle's best damage option early.

Special Effects: +2 attack to all party for 4 turns
Analysis & Notes: WORKING BUT EXPENSIVE: Confirmed functional. 5 EP is steep - needs 4+ turns to pay off.
GOOD: Damage + burn. Comparable to Lightning but adds DOT pressure.
EXCELLENT: Free 15 HP shield. Life-saver for fragile Oracle. Essential survival tool.
VERY GOOD: Cheap damage + debuff. Good defensive option.
EXCELLENT: Highest single-target burst in Oracle kit. Big finisher.
NICHE: Pure DOT. Needs analysis - how much poison damage per turn?

Class: - Level 4: Only Venator has new ability (Evasive Fire). Legionnaire and Oracle have nothing.
- Level 6-9: NO class gets abilities. Long drought.
- Level 11-14: NO class gets abilities. Another drought.
- Level 16-19: NO class gets abilities. Another drought.
- Legionnaire: Gets abilities at 1-2-3-5-10-10-15-20-20 (two at 10 and 20)
Level 4: Evasive Fire (1 ability - Venator only)
1. Oracle's Heal might be underpowered (2d4+2 = 4-10 avg 7). Consider 2d4+3 or 2d4+4.
2. Blessing is expensive (5 EP) and slow payoff. Consider 4 EP or increase buff to +3 attack.
3. Shield Wall prevents attacking - very restrictive. Might be trap option.
4. Venom needs clarification - how much poison damage does it deal per turn?
5. Huge level gaps mean players go many levels without new options.
6. Early game (1-4) is thin - only 10 total abilities for 3 classes.
